MODULE.name: ORM
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: This API class allows you to interact with the local RHOM database and programtically add models or get references to models.
MODULE.MORE_HELP:
## Enabling the API This API is part of the `coreapi` extension that is included automatically. :::ruby extensions: ["coreapi"]
## JavaScript Usage Be sure to review the [JavaScript API Usage](/guide/api_js) guide for important information about using this API in JavaScript
## Ruby Usage Be sure to review the [Ruby API Usage](/guide/api_ruby) guide for important information about using this API in Ruby

METHOD.name: databaseFullReset
METHOD.DESC: Deletes all records from the property bag and model tables.

PARAM.name: resetClientInfo
PARAM.DESC: true to clean the client_info table, false otherwise.

PARAM.name: resetLocalModels
PARAM.DESC: true to clean local (non-synced) models, false otherwise.

PARAM.name: zipName
PARAM.DESC: The name of the zip file

METHOD.name: getClientId
METHOD.DESC: Returns the current sync client id.

METHOD.name: haveLocalChanges
METHOD.DESC: Returns true if any of the Rhodes model objects have local database changes that need to be synchronized, false otherwise.

METHOD.name: databaseFullResetAndLogout
METHOD.DESC: Deletes all records from the property bag and model tables. For examples, see Resetting the Database in Using the Local Database with ORM.

METHOD.name: databaseFullclientResetAndLogout
METHOD.DESC: Reset the Rhodes model database and logout. Equivalent to ORM::ORM.database_full_reset(true) followed by SyncEngine.logout.

METHOD.name: databaseFullResetEx
METHOD.DESC: Deletes all records from the property bag and model tables for the model names passed in parameters.

PARAM.name: propertyMap
PARAM.DESC: Properties map.

PARAM.name: models
PARAM.DESC: Array of models names to reset.

PARAM.name: reset_client_info
PARAM.DESC: If set to true, client_info table will be cleaned.

PARAM.name: reset_local_models
PARAM.DESC: If set to true, local(non-synced models) will be cleaned.

METHOD.name: getModel
METHOD.DESC: Javascript using only. Returns a model.

PARAM.name: modelName
PARAM.DESC: Name of the model you want returned.

METHOD.name: addModel
METHOD.DESC: Javascript using only. Creates ORM model.

PARAM.name: modelName("value")
PARAM.DESC: The name of your model.

PARAM.name: enable("value")
PARAM.DESC: Enables Model Properties.

VALUE.DESC: If set then model is set for RhoConnect Sync
(Default) Model will be of type propertyBag.
Model will be of type fixedSchema

PARAM.name: property("name","type")
PARAM.DESC: Used to create properties on your model.

PARAM.name: name
PARAM.DESC: The name of the property

PARAM.name: type
PARAM.DESC: The type of property value: String, Float, integer, Varchar, Blob - String is default

PARAM.name: addIndex("name",[colArray])
PARAM.DESC: Add an index to your fixedSchema model.

PARAM.name: name
PARAM.DESC: The name of the index

PARAM.name: colArray
PARAM.DESC: Array of model column names to use in index, Ex: ['name','qty']

PARAM.name: addUniqueIndex("name",[colArray])
PARAM.DESC: Add an index to your fixedSchema model.

PARAM.name: name
PARAM.DESC: The name of the index

PARAM.name: colArray
PARAM.DESC: Array of model column names to use in index, Ex: ['name','qty']

PARAM.name: belongs_to("name")
PARAM.DESC: Add belongs_to association to another defined model, for sync models. Comma separted String for more than one model.

PARAM.name: set(property,value)
PARAM.DESC: Set Behavior of this model. Possible `property` options and corresponding values:

PARAM.name: partition
PARAM.DESC: The partition to use for this model. Partitions can be used to segment the data and keep non-synched data seperate from synched models. Possible `values`

VALUE.DESC: This partition is used automatically if the model is not a sync model
This partition is used automatically if the model is a sync model

PARAM.name: sync_type
PARAM.DESC: Sets the type of sync it will be.

VALUE.DESC: If data model is not a sync model
Used when the data model is a sync model. Just syncs changes.

PARAM.name: sync_priority
PARAM.DESC: Determines how frequently to check for changes. In seconds. Default is 1000.

EXAMPLE.title: Add ORM model, create ORM object

SECTION.DESC: This example describes creating model and adding model object.

CODE.RUBY:
class Product include ORM::PropertyBag end
product = Product.create( :brand => 'Apple', :name => 'iPhone5', :price => 199.99)
readedProduct = Product.find(:first) readedProduct.brand #=> "Apple" readedProduct.name #=> "iPhone5"
